inclusion.criterion: Adults with age of 20 years old or above
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Free of active urinary tract infection
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Free of bladder outlet obstruction on enrollment
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients should have severe dysuria or urinary retention, large residual urine and have been treated with medication or other therapeutic modality for over 3 months.
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with severe cardiopulmonary disease and such as congestive heart failure, arrhythmia, poorly controlled hypertension, not able to receive regular follow-up
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients with bladder outlet obstruction on enrollment
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with uncontrolled confirmed diagnosis of acute urinary tract infection
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients have laboratory abnormalities at screening including: Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) > 3 x upper limit of normal range aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > 3 x upper limit of normal range.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients have abnormal serum creatinine level > 2 x upper limit of normal range
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with any contraindication to be urethral catheterization during treatment
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter and multiple prior admissions for UTIs. They have been treated with medication for over 3 months but have a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter.
